alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Burnett; Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:14PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Washburn, southwestern Ashland, southeastern Burnett and central Sawyer Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 413 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Siren, to Spooner, to Chief Lake on Chippewa Flowage, to near Chippewa Flowage East, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Chippewa Flowage East, Couderay, Chief Lake on Chippewa Flowage and Little Round Lake around 420 PM CDT. Chippewa Flowage West and New Post around 430 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Stone Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
